name: Voyage For Survival P1 (2008)
description:
A very short, RPG type game that is not without it's flaws.
Created in 2008 and originally uploaded to Kongregate. This was an ambitious project from both the point of view of my skill level and the tech I was using. All created in timeline AS2! Check out it's features.

  • Day-night cycle
  • Tide (Went out at night allowing you to travel from island to island)
  • Fishing (Level up your fishing and catch bigger fish)
  • Hydration (Get hydro pouch then water from the plants to drink)
  • Hunger (Catch and eat fish - use the desalinator first or you'll vomit)
  • Temperature (Get's too hot in the day, look for shade - will effect health)
  • Suit damage (Taken from crabsters (crab-lobsters))
  • Combat (Fight with crabsters that come out at night - need a bit of wood first)
  • Puzzle - Story to work out and advance the game - this was just a prologue
  • Torch / map / watch / inventory / data disks
  • Simple skill and quest system.
  • Indoor and outdoor environments.
  • Hand-drawn and animated sprites and backgrounds.

It was pretty advanced conceptually and quite nuts, therefor hard to categorize (Maybe survival with story?). SMH that I tried this all with timeline and movieclips, I expect it is probably more than a little buggy too. Now that browser Flash is officially dead, here's the exe, feel free to check out my grand ambitions! It really could have used a tutorial, sorry. Anyway, after this, never again, my next projects were using AS3 OOP, classes. MVC, the works.
